thread.title: 23 Things You Know If You're Lazy But Ambitious
thread.title_full: 23 Things You Know If You're Lazy But Ambitious

author: Hannah Jewell
title: 23 Things You Know If You're Lazy But Ambitious
text:
The goals you had when you were eight sound like a lot of energy nowadays. ID: 10730802 6. You probably get a little ambitious when you’re cooking. View this image › 
giphy.com You’re a master chef. You’re gonna invent a whole new recipe. It’s gonna be amazing.
ID: 10730762 7. But as soon as you imagine all the ingredients you would have to buy, and how much chopping there would be, and how long it would take, you usually give up. View this image › 
imgur.com / BuzzFeed It’s all the same once it’s in your stomach!
ID: 10729560 8. And maybe you’ve even made grand plans for yourself in the shape of a new exercise regimen… i did like 5 squats today so if you catch me looking a lil thick tomorrow don't be alarmed
— Karlee Steel (@karleesteel) ID: 10729578 9. …but those plans tend to go out the window pr tty quickly. View this image › 
Twitter: @WarmingCuteness ID: 10729392 10. You have probably perfected the art of getting things done while barely moving. View this image › 
Twitter: @bortore ID: 10729385 11. Sometimes you can have a pretty productive day without getting dressed at all. View this image › 
Twitter: @HalleighW Doing things is somehow more bearable if you’re in your PJs.
ID: 10729831 12. You spend quite a bit of time envisioning the great things you want for yourself. View this image › 
Fox Nobody wants things the way you want things. You want them the most!
ID: 10730703 13. But you’re also pretty good at just lying there thinking about literally nothing. View this image › 
Fox For hours.
ID: 10730241 14. When you see other people being successful, you always think you could do that too. If you wanted to. View this image › 
CW Which you don’t. Otherwise you would.
ID: 10731867 15. You know that your life goals would probably pan out if you were cleaner and more organised. View this image › 
Maritsa Patrinos / BuzzFeed But you can think of nothing worse than spending the effort it would take to get clean and organised.
ID: 10731958 16. Your laziness has made you pretty inventive, though. View this image › 
Twitter: @gazete_man You think outside the box, because it’s lazier outside the box.
ID: 10730374 17. And it’s done nothing to harm your ego. View this image › 
NBC Because the most important thing is having a healthy attitude, right?
ID: 10730403 18. You just find the whole process of getting started so very difficult. View this image › 
Twitter: @relatablequote ID: 10729857 19. …So sometimes you don’t get started at all. View this image › 
Maritsa Patrinos / BuzzFeed ID: 10732010 20. But if you ever DO get started, you know you’ll be great. View this image › 
allthechildrenoflight.wordpress.com You’ll be the very best.
ID: 10730546 21. The important thing is to keep your imagination alive and well. View this image › 
Twitter: @tinatbh Don’t self help types always go on about thinking things into existence? That’s a thing, right? Cause that sounds great.
ID: 10729972 22. All you have to do is ignore the creeping suspicion that your laziness will prevent you from ever being successful. View this image › 
Channel 4 / Via giphy.com Of course you’ll be fine. You’ll be juuuust fine.
ID: 10730348 23. Just remember, you’re going to do great things! View this image › 
Fox Just as soon as you get out of bed.
ID: 10730858 Check out more articles on BuzzFeed.com! 
Hannah Jewell is a senior staff writer for BuzzFeed News and is based in London.
